“I practice love for my patients,” Raskolnikov said. 

Razumihin laughed. “You’re in a sentimental mood today!” 

Raskolnikov pointed at him. “He has nothing from me but trouble.” 

Avdotya Romanovna watched her brother closely. 

“I realize how distressed you were yesterday,” he said, reaching for her hand. 

His smile revealed true feeling. 

Dounia squeezed his hand, relieved and grateful. 

Their mother beamed with joy at their silent reconciliation. 

Razumihin muttered, “He has these movements.” 

The mother thought, “What generous impulses he has.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's gesture of reconciliation with his sister reveals his underlying emotional turmoil and the complexity of familial relationships.
